page.title: 15McINTYRE HALL:SHELTERED ACC.
page.content: McIntyre Hall is a{residential {dwelling}consisting of 29{flats.} Three of these flats house couples and the rest are for single folk. The flats are{self-contained}where the old people can cook for themselves. The flats are owned by the council and run by them. A small rent is charged. The hall is managed by a{full_time {warden}and a part_time relief warden. There are also cleaning staff. The old people have to be independent. There is a red cord in the bathroom, one in the kitchen behind the door and one in the bedroom so that the old people can pull when they are in difficulty and the warden will attend to them. A cooker is provided in each flat. There is a lift and a staircase. When the old people have visitors, there is a room where they can go.
